body:
> The code changes to support that are trivial, would you accept a pull request?

we always do ;)
However it is probably a binary breaking change, so it can't be in play before 2.7
I don't think it would be a breaking change, we could keep the current `withTransaction` method and add another one that supports the transaction isolation level.
the problem is, that `Database` is a trait and adding methods to a trait will **always** break binary compatibility.
Ah, good point, I'll upload a pull request soon.

Thanks for the interest here, @AlexITC.

A small note only: this also needs to be done for the Java API so that we can keep it on par with the Scala API. :-)

Yeah, that's what has stopped me to do upload the pull request until now.

In any case, I was thinking on doing an explicit rollback to the transaction isolation level, while some connection pool libraries like HIkariCP do this automatically, I think it is better to not expect that to avoid having weird bugs, what do you guys think?
Hi, I have use Play for a long time, Can I take care of this issue?

issue.title: Add .withTransaction(isolationLevel: TransactionIsolationLevel)

milestone.title: Play 2.8.0-M1
milestone.description:
First Play milestone release.

Highlights are:
* using Akka 2.6.0-M2, and
* cross-building to Scala 2.13.0-RC2

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
# Pull Request Checklist

* [X] Have you read [How to write the perfect pull request](https://github.com/blog/1943-how-to-write-the-perfect-pull-request)?
* [X] Have you read through the [contributor guidelines](https://www.playframework.com/contributing)?
* [X] Have you signed the [Lightbend CLA](https://www.lightbend.com/contribute/cla)?
* [X] Have you referenced any issues you're fixing using [commit message keywords](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-using-keywords/)?
* [X] Have you added copyright headers to new files?
* [X] Have you checked that both Scala and Java APIs are updated?
* [x] Have you updated the documentation for both Scala and Java sections?
* [x] Have you added tests for any changed functionality?

# Helpful things

## Fixes

Fixes #8466 

## Purpose

Allow set Transaction Isolation level

## Background Context

I love Playframework and need to join Hacktoberfest

## References

Are there any relevant issues / PRs / mailing lists discussions?

body:
> At the moment, there is no way to specify the transaction isolation level for a single transaction, it would be great to have a syntax like this:
> 
> ```scala
> database.withTransaction(TransactionIsolationLevel.Serializable) { implicit conn => ... }
> ```
> 
> The code changes to support that are trivial, would you accept a pull request?

Input should be a new enum or just Int by (Connection.TRANSACTION_%)?

BTW, In case of Enum, How to manage enum on both Java and Scala?

This is the draft that I had completed but it works for Scala only, the idea was to use an ADT instead of ints because the compiler would prevent certain mistakes: https://gist.github.com/AlexITC/d003adf96ee11db69671a193fa8799fe

Can we use standard Scala Enumeration? 

> object TransactionIsolationLevel extends Enumeration

This should be the last question, I have found validate-code failed.
> abstract method withTransaction(play.db.TransactionIsolationLevel,play.db.ConnectionCallable)java.lang.Object in interface play.db.Database is present only in current version

Which part of a project I should looking for?
Could you upload the patch? seeing what you are trying to do might help us to help.
Now, all CI checkpoint has done. Could you help review?
Done, we could continue the discussion there.
